private_information: I specialize in extracting symbolic structures (objects, predicates, and action schemas) from natural language task descriptions.
I do not emit PDDL; I return normalized JSON-like schemas that other agents can use.
fact_extractor.goal: Derive a clean, unambiguous, normalized action model (names, parameters, preconditions, add and delete effects) and the set of predicates and objects from the public information.

private_information: I aggregate initial conditions and goals into structured scenarios.
I ensure object universes, facts, and goals are explicit and consistent across scenarios.
I do not emit PDDL; I produce JSON-like scenario bundles.
state_assembler.goal: Produce structured scenarios (A and B) with explicit objects, initial facts, and goal facts that align with the extracted action model.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of plans by forward-simulating action applications under the given preconditions and effects.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts and reject quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-causal justifications.
I do not emit PDDL; I return validation results and, if needed, corrected plans and causal link analyses.
auditor.goal: Validate the provided plan for Scenario A against the action model and scenario facts, produce a causal explanation, and highlight any inconsistencies. Provide guidance for Scenario B if gaps exist.

private_information: I convert the extracted action schemas into a PDDL-ready intermediate representation, normalizing predicate signatures and parameter roles.
I do not emit PDDL; I output a clean IR mapping that the orchestrator can compile into PDDL.
symbolic_modeler.goal: Transform the normalized semantics into a PDDL-ready IR with explicit predicate dictionaries, parameter specifications, and effect lists suitable for compilation.

private_information: I coordinate the other agents' artifacts and emit the final PDDL artifacts for the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the semantic model, audited plan insights, and scenarios to produce a correct PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for Scenario B, suitable for FastDownward.

public_information: Actions available: paltry(o0 o1 o2), sip(o0 o1 o2), clip(o0 o1 o2), wretched(o0 o1 o2 o3), memory(o0 o1 o2), tightfisted(o0 o1 o2).
paltry preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: vase o0 o1.
sip preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2; effects add: vase o0 o1; effects del: next o0 o2.
clip preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2; effects add: vase o0 o1; effects del: next o0 o2.
wretched preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: next o0 o1.
memory preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: next o0 o1.
tightfisted preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: vase o0 o1.

[STATEMENT A] Initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_6, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8. Goal: next object_9 object_7.

[PLAN A] wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; clip object_9 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_5; sip object_9 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_7; paltry object_9 object_0 object_7.

[STATEMENT B] Initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, next object_0 object_8, next object_1 object_6, next object_10 object_9, next object_4 object_6, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9. Goal: next object_10 object_6.
[PLAN B] No plan provided; must be solved by a planner.

extract_semantics.system_prompt: You are a knowledge engineer extracting symbolic models from natural language. Produce a concise JSON-like schema describing: 1) objects; 2) predicates with arities; 3) action schemas with parameter roles; 4) for each action: preconditions, add_effects, del_effects. Do not emit PDDL.
extract_semantics.prompt: Your name is fact_extractor. Read the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Return a normalized action model and predicate inventory aligned with the given actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted). Use consistent lower-case names and parameters (e.g., ?x ?y). Avoid PDDL; return a compact JSON-like structure.

assemble_scenarios.system_prompt: You aggregate the initial conditions and goals into structured scenarios that are consistent with the extracted semantics. Do not emit PDDL.
assemble_scenarios.prompt: Your name is state_assembler. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and the extracted semantics {semantics}, assemble two scenarios: A and B. For each scenario, specify: objects (universe), init_facts (as ground atoms), and goal_facts. Ensure no missing objects and keep names consistent.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You are a temporal/causal consistency auditor. Validate the provided plan for Scenario A by forward-simulating preconditions and effects. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and reject any quota tokens or post-hoc penalties. If inconsistencies exist, provide a corrected plan or explain why none exists. Do not emit PDDL.
audit_plan.prompt: Your name is auditor. Using {semantics} and {scenarios}, audit [PLAN A] from the public information. Provide: validity (true/false), step-by-step causal trace, any corrections, and notes that will help the orchestrator generate a correct domain/problem. For Scenario B, list open preconditions that a planner must satisfy.

build_ir.system_prompt: You translate the normalized action schemas into a PDDL-ready intermediate representation with explicit predicate dictionaries, parameter specifications, and effect structures. Do not emit PDDL.
build_ir.prompt: Your name is symbolic_modeler. From {semantics}, produce an IR suitable for direct compilation into PDDL: include types (if any), predicates with argument sorts, and action templates with parameters, preconditions, add and delete lists. Keep names consistent and lowercase.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and FastDownward. Integrate the provided artifacts to produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for Scenario B. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs (positive preconditions, add and delete effects). Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Keep predicate and object names consistent with the inputs. Output plain text without explanations.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Use the semantics {semantics}, scenarios {scenarios}, audit results {audited_plan}, and IR {ir}. Produce one PDDL domain capturing actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameters reflecting the given roles and effects, and one PDDL problem for Scenario B using its objects, init facts, and goal next object_10 object_6. Ensure the result is compatible with FastDownward.
